content:
• Thursday, June 21, 2018
  • SGLB

    Sigma Labs -7.2% amid proposed offering

    • Quality assurance software maker Sigma Labs (NASDAQ:SGLB) is off 7.2% in postmarket trading after announcing a proposed public offering of common stock, warrants and convertible preferred shares.
    • Terms of the offering aren't set yet.
    • Preferred stock would be offered in lieu of common shares to any investor where the result would be beneficial ownership over 4.99%.
    • Dawson James Securities is exclusive placement agent.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:39 PM
  • TCS

    Container Store dips on holder's filing to sell up to 32.49M shares

    • The Container Store Group (NYSE:TCS) is 3.1% lower in light aftermarket trading after an S-3 filing from a holder expecting to offer up to 32,492,421 shares.
    • That's at a maximum offer price/share of $8.71, or aggregate price of just over $283M. Shares closed at that price today, and are quoting at $8.44 postmarket.
    • The Container Store won't receive any proceeds.
     
     
     
     
    | 7:22 PM | 2 Comments
  • TNDM

    After Hours Gainers / Losers (06/21/2018)

    • Top gainers: TNDM +5.7%. TEO +4.4%. CRCM +3.2%. CX +2.5%. AOI +2.1%.
    • Top Losers: RHT -10.8%. NWY -3.4%.  TLRA -1.8%. SPLK -1.7%. MSFT -1.3%.
     
     
     
     
    | 5:35 PM | 26 Comments
  • AMCX

    AMC Networks -3.6% as Bernstein cuts to Underperform

    • AMC Networks (NASDAQ:AMCX) fell 3.6% today, pulling back from the edge of a 52-week high hit last Friday, after a cut to Underperform at Bernstein -- which is fading the likelihood the network will get acquired at a premium.
    • There's no motivated buyers for AMC (or other "free radicals" like Discovery (NASDAQ:DISCA) and Viacom (VIA, VIAB)), analyst Todd Juenger says, highlighting the difference between them and recent targets like Time Warner and Fox.
    • Figuring an 80/20 chance against an acquisition (and estimations of stand-alone value of $53/share vs. takeout of $82), he expects the price target is $59, about 9.3% downside from today's close. (h/t Bloomberg)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:57 PM | 8 Comments
  • SLAB

    Loop Capital initiates Silicon Labs at 10% upside

    • Loop Capital starts Silicon Labs (NASDAQ:SLAB) at a Hold rating and $116 price target.
    • The target represents a 10% upside to today’s close. 
    • Silicon Labs is up 0.7% aftermarket to $105.84.       
     
     
     
     
    | 4:54 PM
  • PEGA

    Pegasystems increases share repurchase program to $50M

    • Pegasystems (NASDAQ:PEGA) announces its board has authorized an expansion to the current share repurchase program.
    • The amount increases from the $23.5M remaining to $50M. 
    • The expansion is effective until June 30, 2019.   
    • Pegasystems shares are up 0.3% aftermarket to $58.26.    
     
     
     
     
    | 4:45 PM
  • RHT

    Red Hat -10.8% on Q1 beats, downside Q2 guidance

    • Red Hat (NYSE:RHT) plunges 10.8% aftermarket on Q1 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 20% Y/Y revenue growth. Downside Q2 guidance has revenue of $822M to $830M (consensus: $854.74M) and EPS of $0.81 (consensus: $0.89).
    • Mixed FY19 guidance has revenue from $3.375B to $3.41B (consensus: $3.45B; was: $3.425B to $3.46B) and EPS from $3.44 to $3.48 (consensus: $3.43; was: $3.38 to $3.41). 
    • Key metrics: Application Development-rated and other emerging tech subscription revenue, $189M (+37% Y/Y); operating cash flow, $346M (+34%); deferred revenue balance, $2.4B (+19%); cash and equivalents, $2.5B; capital allocations, $150M share repurchase; total operating expenses, $578.7M. 
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 5 PM with a webcast available here.
    • Press release.  
    • Previously: Red Hat beats by $0.03, beats on revenue (June 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 4:37 PM | 22 Comments
  • TNDM

    FDA OKs Tandem's t:slim X2 insulin pump with hypoglycemia management feature; shares up 1% after hours

    • Tandem Diabetes Care (NASDAQ:TNDM) is up 1% after hours on light volume on the heels of the FDA's approval of its t:slim X2 Insulin Pump with Basal-IQ, a predictive low glucose suspend feature aimed at reducing the frequency and duration of hypoglycemic (low blood sugar) events.
    • The device is approved for use by diabetics as young as six years.
    • Related tickers: SENS, DXCM, ABT, MDT, PODD
     
     
     
     
    | 4:21 PM | 11 Comments
  • SGH

    SMART Global Holdings reports Q3 beats, upside revenue guidance

    • SMART Global Holdings (NASDAQ:SGH) gains 0.2% aftermarket on Q3 results that beat EPS and revenue estimates with a 62% Y/Y revenue growth. Q4 guidance has upside revenue of $360M to $380M (consensus: $348.50M) and in-line EPS of $1.62 to $1.71 (consensus: $1.67).
    • Earnings call is scheduled for 4:30 PM Eastern with a replay available here.
    • Press release
    • Previously: SMART Global Holdings beats by $0.07, beats on revenue (June 21)
    • Post updated to correct guidance.
     
     
     
     
    | 4:15 PM | 28 Comments
  • LDOS

    Leidos, Harris drop on cancelled Peraton contract

    • Leidos (NYSE:LDOS) shares drop 1.2% on a Washington Business Journal report that the TSA cancelled a $578M contract with its competitor Peraton.
    • Peraton was spun-out from Harris Corporation (NYSE:HRS), which is down 1.6% to $142.85.  
     
     
     
     
    | 3:42 PM | 4 Comments
  • CENX

    Century Aluminum +5% as B. Riley starts at Buy; Alcoa only rates Neutral

    • Century Aluminum (CENX +5.3%) surges at B. Riley starts coverage with a Buy rating and $27 price target, seeing the company helped by expected lower alumina prices; because CENX is not fully vertically integrated, the company has been facing the full brunt of higher prices, says analyst Lucas Pipes.
    • The firm also likes CENX's large exposure to the U.S., and "with aluminum prices and Midwest premiums at attractive levels, we believe the company will be able to generate strong free cash flow in the coming years."
    • But Pipes initiates Alcoa (AA -1.2%) with a Neutral rating and $47 price target, saying higher alumina prices that have helped the company "tremendously" are likely to decline.
    • Pipes also thinks the market is underestimating how soon Alcoa's pensions could be fully funded, but it is poor timing as investors intently focused on capital returns are keeping valuation in check, a situation he thinks is likely to continue until the pension obligation is funded.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:32 PM | 1 Comment
  • SENS

    FDA OKs Senseonics Eversense CGM device; shares up 1%

    • The FDA approves Senseonics Holdings' (SENS +1.2%) Eversense Continuous Glucose Monitoring (CGM) System. The device features an implantable sensor that lasts up to 90 days.
    • Management will host a conference call today at 4:30 pm ET to discuss the approval and market launch plans.
    • Related tickers: (TNDM -2.2%)(DXCM -1%)(ABT -0.9%)(MDT -0.1%)(PODD -1.9%)
     
     
     
     
    | 3:25 PM | 22 Comments
  • FOX

    Fox gains again; Loop Capital boosts target on bidding war

    • Shares in Twenty-First Century Fox (FOX +2.1%, FOXA +1.6%) are continuing their recent run after Loop Capital boosted its price target.
    • The firm targets FOXA at $51, up from $47, vs. current pricing of $48.84.
    • It's clear that Comcast (CMCSA -1.6%) and Disney (DIS -0.8%) are "all in" with their bids for Fox's media assets, analyst Alan Gould writes. Comcast will go to the low $40s with a bid, and Disney will top again (likely to $42), he says, thinking Comcast is "close to its limit." (h/t Bloomberg)
    • Fox is still likely to prefer Disney equity over Comcast equity, he adds, if it comes to that.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:12 PM | 3 Comments
  • NE

    Noble Corp. downgraded at Jefferies as offshore drillers drop

    • Noble Corp. (NE -4.3%) plunges amid broader losses in the oil and gas sector, as Jefferies downgrades shares to Hold from Buy with a $5 price target, cut from $5.50, citing "ample downside risk" to 2019 estimates that leaves the stock fairly valued after its 18% YTD run.
    • Oilfield service stocks have been moving higher thanks to rising oil prices, but Jefferies analyst Eduardo Royes sees "few tangible positives" in the rig market, as contracting still remains relatively unchanged from the last year's depressed levels and many operators seem content not to ramp up their activity; "as such, the contracted floater rig count remains range-bound," Royes writes.
    • Among offshore drillers, Royes only sees value in Transocean (RIG -4.4%), which he maintains with a Buy rating and raises his price target to $15; he rates Diamond Offshore (DO -1.8%) at Underperform.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:08 PM | 41 Comments
  • XRX

    Xerox lower after judge's ruling

    • Xerox (XRX -2.8%) drops to a session low after a judge in the Fujifilm case doesn't dissolve an injunction blocking the merger between the two companies.
    • Shares of XRX hit a 52-week low of $26.42 after the ruling broke.
     
     
     
     
    | 3:03 PM | 3 Comments
  • ABIL

    Technology - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 2.55 PM (06/21/2018)

    • Gainers: ABIL +90%. AGMH +17%. BOXL +15%. AVLR +12%. IGLD +12%.
    • Losers: CLPS -21%. VERI -17%. STMP -12%. BILI -10%. ACMR -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:58 PM
  • RRTS

    Roadrunner Transportation breaks higher

    • Shares of Roadrunner Transportation Systems (NYSE:RRTS) are up 12.88% in a notable comeback from some selling pressure earlier this week.
    • Trading volume on Roadrunner continues to be above the historic average.
    • Previously: Roadrunner -9% after former execs charged with fraud (June 18)
     
     
     
     
    | 2:38 PM | 3 Comments
  • WLK

    Westlake upgraded at Bernstein as top play on Chinese pollution crackdown

    • Westlake Chemical (WLK +1.8%) is higher after Bernstein initiates shares with an Outperform rating and $150 price target, citing its strong exposure to the chlor-alkali chain which is benefiting from China's pollution crackdown.
    • China's ambitions to address environmental issues could prove to be the "most impactful" event in the chemical industry since the advent of shale gas, the firm says, adding that WLK is "one of the best ways" to gain exposure.
    • The firm also thinks WLK's 71% ownership by the Chao family as a positive since it makes CEO Albert Chao "highly incentivized" to perform well and generate strong returns.
    • Bernstein also starts coverage of Westlake Chemical Partners (WLKP -0.6%) with a Market Perform rating and $25 price target.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:34 PM
  • FTR

    Frontier -6.7% as CFO resigns

    • Frontier Communications (NYSE:FTR) is down 6.7% and matching its lowest point since February following the resignation of its chief financial officer.
    • R. Perley McBride is exiting his post for personal reasons and returning to his family in Atlanta, the company says.
    • He'll stay in the job until Aug. 31 to help with transition; the company's searching for a successor.
    • McBride did a tremendous job with the balance sheet, CEO Daniel McCarthy says: "He has negotiated improvements in the terms of our credit agreements, raised $1.6B of new second lien debt, and retired approximately $1.7B of unsecured notes."
     
     
     
     
    | 2:20 PM | 36 Comments
  • SNE

    Videogame sales up for 2nd month with hardware driving

    • Videogame sales grew for the second straight month overall in May, with continued growth in hardware and accessories more than mitigating a slight drop in software.
    • Sales rose 13% Y/Y to $685M, according to NPD Group. While software sales fell 4% to $274M, hardware was up 26% to $186M, and accessories sales grew 30% to $225M.
    • Year-to-date sales are still up across the board (+15% overall, to $4.9B).
    • Hardware is up 15% YTD to $1.3B; PlayStation 4 (SNE -0.8%) remains the best-selling console hardware platform, while the single best-selling SKU belonged to the Nintendo (NTDOY -0.8%) Switch 32GB with Neon Red/Blue JoyCon. Accessories spending is up 29% YTD to $1.4B.
    • Software was down due to a tough comparable against last year's release of Injustice 2, analyst Mat Piscatella notes. A soft release slate had the dollar sales chart topped by State of Decay 2 (MSFT -0.5%), followed by a pair of Sony (NYSE:SNE) releases: God of War 2018 and Detroit: Become Human. The No. 4 spot was held down by 2018 best-seller Far Cry 5 (UBSFY -1.1%), followed by Donkey Kong Country: Tropical Freeze (OTCPK:NTDOY).
    • Rounding out the top 10 in software: No. 6, Grand Theft Auto V (TTWO -0.8%); No. 7, Hyrule Warriors Definitive Edition (OTCPK:NTDOY); No. 8, Tom Clancy's Rainbox Six: Siege (OTCPK:UBSFY), No. 9, Mario Kart 8 (OTCPK:NTDOY), and No. 10, NBA 2K18 (NASDAQ:TTWO).
    • Related tickers: ATVI -1.4%, EA -0.3%, OTCPK:CCOEY +6.7%, OTC:NCBDY
    • ETF: GAMR -0.5%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:07 PM | 17 Comments
  • RNGR

    Energy/Materials - Top Gainers / Losers as of 2:00 PM (06/21/2018)

    • Gainers: RNGR +12%. YTEN +7%. CENX +6%.
    • Losers: GEVO -28%. WTI -8%. EPE -8%. DWSN -7%. GPRK -6%.
     
     
     
     
    | 2:00 PM
  • PF

    Pinnacle Food +3% amid ConAgra talk

    • Pinnacle Foods (PF +2.5%) trades higher after Bloomberg reports that the company has held talks recently with ConAgra Brands (CAG).
    • Speculation on a PF-CAG deal has lingered for a few months.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:54 PM | 2 Comments
  • OSTK

    Overstock.com reacts to SCOTUS decision

    • Overstock.com (OSTK -6.8%) calls on Congress to intervene and legislate a fair solution in the wake of today’s Supreme Court ruling on online sales tax collection, which it says could impact on innovative internet startups.
    • “Though the impact of the Court’s ruling today will be clarified by further proceedings in the lower court, we are prepared to comply with any outcome, and the decision will have no appreciable impact on our business,” says Overstock.com board member Jonathan Johnson.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 1:34 PM | 2 Comments
  • EVTZF

    More on Evertz Technologies's Q4 results

    • Evertz Technologies (OTCPK:EVTZF) reported Q4 revenue of C$93M (-12.9% Y/Y). Region wise revenue: US/Canada C$52.1M (-10% Y/Y) and International C$40.9M (-16.4% Y/Y).
    • Q4 Overall margins: Gross declined by 355 bps to 52.7% and operating margin declined by 1,330 bps to 12.5%.
    • Q4 expenses: S&A was C$17.83M (+8.53% Y/Y), General C$1.98M (-18.1% Y/Y) and R&D C$21.02M (+5.4% Y/Y).
    • Purchase order backlog was C$85M at the end of May 2018.
    • Shipments for the month of May 2018 were C$32M.
    • Cash and cash equivalents were C$94.2M as of April 30, 2018.
    • Previously: Evertz Technologies reports Q4 results (June 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 1:23 PM
  • BFR

    Financials - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 1:00 PM (06/21/2018)

    • Gainers: BFR +16%. SUPV +12%. BMA +10%. GGAL +8%. IRS +6%.
    • Losers: ACGL -68%. DNJR -13%. GROW -7%. MC -7%.
     
     
     
     
    | 1:00 PM
  • STMP

    Stamps.com -12% on threat of post office restructuring

    • Shares of Stamps.com (NASDAQ:STMP) are down 12.20% after the White House proposes a restructuring of the U.S. Postal Service.
    • The plan from the Trump Administration could include a privatization of some mail delivery.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:52 PM | 18 Comments
  • XBIO

    Midday Gainers / Losers (06/21/2018)

    • Gainers: XBIO +151%. ABIL +79%. ASCMA +48%. SBOT +38%. HRTX +33%. RYTM +23%. BNED +20%. BOXL +17%. BFR +16%. AVLR +14%.
      •  
    • Losers: NVIV -46%. GEVO -27%. NAKD -21%. CLPS -20%. FORD -20%. CLBS -17%. VERI -16%. FCEL -16%. AETI -15%. OTC:ARDM -15%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:41 PM | 2 Comments
  • LMNR

    Limoneira expands globally with Chilean acquisition

    • Limoneira (LMNR -5.8%) to acquire a ranch and related assets of Fruticola San Pablo S.A in La Serena, Chile for $13M.
    • The San Pablo ranch consists of 3,317 total acres on two parcels, including 247 acres producing lemons, 61 acres producing oranges, the opportunity to immediately plant 120 acres for lemon production, as well as the potential for ~500 acres of avocado production.
    • The Company expects the acquisition to add $0.02 - $0.03 in EPS in fiscal 2018, and $0.06 - $0.08 in fiscal 2019.  The acquisition is expected to close in July 2018.
    • Previously: Limoneira lower on $50M public share offering (June 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:29 PM | 2 Comments
  • SHPG

    Shire boosts plasma manufacturing capacity 30%; shares up 1%

    • Shire plc (SHPG +1.4%) is up on below-average volume on the heels of its announcement that that FDA has signed off on its new plasma manufacturing facility that will make GAMMAGARD LIQUID [Immune Globulin Infusion (Human)] 10% Solution, a replacement therapy for primary humoral immunodeficiency.
    • The Covington, GA-located operation will add 30% to its internal plasma manufacturing capacity after production ramps up.
    • Later this year, the company plans to submit another application to the FDA seeking approval to make its albumin therapy there.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:23 PM
  • CLPS

    CLPS erases about 40% of yesterday's gain

    • CLPS (NASDAQ:CLPS) sinks 18% a day after it surged by 56%, when the company released a letter to shareholders outlining expansion plans.
    • The China-based fintech company went public at $5.25 a share on June 4.
    • Volume at midday 917,886; its average since going public on June 4 is 2.32M.
    • Previously: CLPS surges 26% as letter to shareholders discusses expansion plans (June 20)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:19 PM
  • RNVA

    Rennova Health down 14.7% post Q1 results

    • Rennova Health (OTCPK:RNVA -14.7%) reports Q1 revenue growth of 135.3% Y/Y to $1.6M.
    • G&A expenses decreased 13% Y/Y to $2.9M & and also there was a decline in S&M expenses of ~100% Y/Y.
    • Bad debt expense was $0.6M, as compared to zero Y/Y, the increase is related to allowance for doubtful accounts and allowance billing adjustments by insurance companies.
    • The company completed the acquisition of second rural hospital in Jamestown, Tennessee at a total cost of ~$1.1M from Community Health Systems.
    • Also, raised $3M in private placements of convertible notes & increased authorized common stock to 3B shares.
    • Separated and progressed plans to spin out two divisions, Genetic diagnostics and interpretation and the Software division.
    • For Q1, the company had $35K in cash on hand from continuing operations; a working capital deficit of $174.8M and a stockholders deficit of $183.9M.
    • Also, incurred a loss from continuing operations of $3.7M.
    • Previously: Rennova Health reports Q1 results (June 19)
     
     
     
     
    | 12:12 PM | 3 Comments
  • ALKS

    Alkermes slumps 12% after MS downgrade

    • Alkermes plc (ALKS -11.7%) is down on average volume on the heels of a downgrade to Underweight at Morgan Stanley. Analyst David Risinger also lowered his price target to $42 (8% downside risk) from $67 citing growth concerns with top seller Vivitrol and risks of negative news on late-stage candidates in schizophrenia and depression in the coming months.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:05 PM | 3 Comments
  • FAMI

    Consumer - Top Gainers / Losers as of 12:00 PM (06/21/2018)

    • Gainers: FAMI +8%. EAST +6%. CRESY +6%.
    • Losers: FORD -20%. NAKD -17%. ADOM -13%. SCS -11%. NBEV -10%.
     
     
     
     
    | 12:00 PM
  • HES

    Focus on returns now to hurt long-term U.S. shale investment, Hess CEO says

    • Investor pressure on oil producers to focus more attention on shareholder returns and less on production will drive down needed investment over the long term, Hess (HES -1.5%) CEO John Hess says at the OPEC meeting in Vienna.
    • “Investor sentiment in the last year has really, markedly changed. I’d say it’s gone from, ‘drill, baby, drill,’ to ‘show me the money,’” Hess says. “While that financial discipline is healthy, I think it does act like a brake on long-term investment."
    • “There’s a worldwide obsession with shale. In the U.S., it’s irrational exuberance, and in other countries it’s irrational fear,” Hess also says, adding that he does not expect the industry to gain traction in other countries.
    • Hess does not operate in any OPEC member nation but is still sponsoring an oil seminar at this week's meeting.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:48 AM | 1 Comment
  • NYT

    NYT at 11-year high; Huber pivots to Buy

    • The New York Times Co. (NYSE:NYT) is up 2% and at its highest point in 11 years alongside a two-notch upgrade from Huber Research, to Overweight.
    • The firm's Douglas Arthur sees positives not only from digital subscriptions driven by the election, but also advertising and real estate. Next year the company has the option to repay a 10-year $250M leaseback and reclaim ownership of its headquarters (which he values at $1B) at the 2009 price, he says. (h/t Bloomberg)
    • He also notes the stock has performed despite heavy selling by the likes of Carlos Slim (10M shares this year).
     
     
     
     
    | 11:46 AM | 3 Comments
  • INTC

    Intel announces upside preliminary Q2 results

    • Intel (NASDAQ:INTC) preannounced Q2 results earlier today when it announced the resignation of CEO Brian Krzanich.
    • Intel expects $16.9B in revenue (consensus: $16.29B) and EPS of $0.99 (consensus: $0.85).
    • Intel shares are down 1.7% to $52.52.
    • Previously: Intel announces upside preliminary Q2 results (June 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:29 AM | 49 Comments
  • CEO

    Cnooc's Nexen to move forward with C$400M Canada oil sands project

    • Cnooc's (CEO -3%) Nexen Energy says it will move ahead with work on a new C$400M (US$300M) expansion of its Long Lake project in Alberta, marking a rare return of foreign direct investment to Canada's oil sands.
    • Nexen says the expansion will add 26K bbl/day to production at Long Lake, with first oil expected in late 2020.
    • The decision shows Cnooc's willingness to invest in the oil sands and thus is a positive sign for the sector, and suggests some companies are starting to proceed with their mothballed projects as U.S. crude oil prices stay well above $60/bbl, says Kevin Birn, VP of North American crude oil markets at IHS Markit.
    • The per-barrel costs of the new project are 50% lower than what Nexen was paying for expansion projects before the 2014 oil price collapse, Birn says.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:28 AM
  • HNWEF

    Hanwei Energy Services slides 82% post FY results

    • Hanwei Energy Services (OTC:HNWEF) reports FY revenue growth of 41.2% Y/Y to C$10.6M, the increase was driven by the growth in FRP pipe sales, primarily in the Company’s China market.
    • Total Pipe revenue was C$9.1M (+82% Y/Y) & Oil and Gas of C$1.5M (-40% Y/Y).
    • Revenues from the Company’s China FRP pipe market increased by 281% Y/Y to C$6.6M whereas, revenues from the Canadian FRP pipe market decreased 42% Y/Y to ~C$1.8M.
    • Total adj. EBITDA margin improved 1,400 bps to 3%; for Pipe increased 1,900 bps to 21% & declined 4,700 bps to -46% for Oil and Gas.
    • In 2018, the Company produced ~107boe/d (-50.9% Y/Y), including 58 bbl/d of oil (-28.4% Y/Y), 224 mcf/d of gas (-63.3% Y/Y) and 12 boe/d of liquids (-65.7% Y/Y).
    • The Company brought its Leduc Lands back on test production on May 19, 2018.  Test production oil volume is currently at ~250 bbl/d.
    • The total principal amount of all short-term loans was C$5.1M representing a 38% debt to equity ratio.
    • Cash and equivalents was ~C$1M & the company had a Net Asset Value per share for its continuing operations of C$0.13.
    • Previously: Hanwei Energy Services reports FY results (June 21)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:25 AM
  • ASCMA

    Ascent Capital bounces 53% from 52-week low, still down 83% from 52-week high

    • Ascent Capital Group (NASDAQ:ASCMA) rises 53% to $2.60 in late morning trading on volume more than 10 times' its three-month daily average, a bit of bounce from yesterday's 52-week low of $1.68.
    • Today's gain makes little progress in regaining ground lost in the past 11 months. ASMA's 52-week high was $17.84 on July 25..
    • Previously: Ascent Capital misses by $1.12, beats on revenue (May 8)
     
     
     
     
    | 11:22 AM | 7 Comments
  • AVLR

    Avalara soars after SCOTUS ruling

    • Avalara (NYSE:AVLR) skies 28.1% after the Supreme Court rules that states can enforce the collection of online sales tax.
    • Shares of AVLR hit a post-IPO high of $58.22 off the expectation that the company's business will take off due to the SCOTUS ruling.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:11 AM | 9 Comments
  • XBIO

    Healthcare - Top 5 Gainers / Losers as of 11:00 AM (06/21/2018)

    • Gainers: XBIO +164%. SBOT +61%. HRTX +29%. RYTM +21%. CASI +14%.
    • Losers: NVIV -44%. MBRX -15%. PCRX -15%. NEPT -12%. OCUL -11%.
     
     
     
     
    | 11:00 AM | 1 Comment
  • EPRT

    Essential Properties initial trade falls short of IPO price

    • Essential Properties Realty Trust's (NYSE:EPRT) opens trading on NYSE at 3.6% below its initial public offering price of $14.00.
    • EPRT sold 32.5M shares of common stock in its public offering. Together with a private offering of shares and common units of its Eldridge Industries unit, the company raised $542.7M.
    • Source: Press Release
     
     
     
     
    | 10:48 AM
  • MU

    Analysts raise Micron price targets after earnings

    • JPMorgan reiterates its Overweight rating for Micron (NASDAQ:MU) after earnings and raises the price target from $82 to $84, a 43% upside to yesterday’s close.
    • Analyst Harlan Sur says the company continues to benefit from “strong cloud data center demand with cloud DRAM revenues up 33% Q/Q.” 
    • Sur: “In terms of the industry environment, we expect broader memory fundamentals to remain constructive into next year led by continued demand strength in data center.” 
    • Stifel reaffirms its Buy rating and raises its Micron target by $2 to $108. 
    • Analyst Kevin Cassidy also cites cloud spending as a continued tailwind. 
    • Mizuho maintains a Buy rating and raises its target by $2 to $72. 
    • Analyst Vijay Rakesh: “We continue to see DRAM and NAND spot pricing relatively stable as we move through the JunQ and into 2H18, which would be much better than initial fears.”

  • HRTX

    Heron pain med HTX-011 successful in mid-stage studies; shares up 23% premarket

    • Heron Therapeutics (NASDAQ:HRTX) is up 23% premarket on the heels of its announcement of positive results from two Phase 2b clinical trials evaluating local anesthetic HTX-011.
    • The first, Study 209, showed administration with HTX-011 alone in patients undergoing total knee arthroplasty (knee replacement) reduced pain intensity 19% versus placebo (p=0.0002). When administered with ropivacaine or bupivacaine, pain intensity was reduced 23% compared to placebo (p<0.0001), significantly better that ropivacaine or bupivacaine alone. The HTX-011 combination approach significantly reduced opioid use through 48 and 72 hours post surgery.
    • The second, Study 211, evaluated the pain-reducing effect of HTX-011 in patients undergoing breast augmentation when administered into the surgical site or via lateral or medial pectoral nerve block before surgery. Treatment with HTX-011, administered either way, showed a statistically significant 22% reduction in pain intensity compared to placebo (p=0.0023 and p=0.0055, respectively). The pain reduction from HTX-011 was ~3x that of bupivacaine administered as a nerve block.
    • HTX-011 is an injectable formulation based on the company's Bichronomer polymer-based drug delivery platform which enables the release of bupivacaine and meloxicam over an extended period. It has Breakthrough Therapy status for the management of postoperative pain.
    • The company will host a conference call momentarily to discuss the data.
     
     
     
     
    | 8:31 AM | 3 Comments
